question.text:
How many statements are incorrect?

(i) The function of germ pore is the initiation of the pollen tube.
(ii) The coconut water and edible part of coconut are equivalent to endosperm and endocarp, respectively.
(iii) When pollen is shed at the three-celled stage, syngamy occurs more quickly than the pollen when sheds at two called stage.
(iv) Intine is made up of cellulose and pectin.
(v) Pollen grains in some plants remain viable for months.

solution.text:
Pollen grain is the structure that contains the male gametic cell participating in the fertilization process. Pollen grain has two layers- exine- outer covering made of sporopollelin and intine- inner layer primarily having cellulose and pectins. Pollen grains travel quite a distance in cross pollination process thus, they remain viable for months in many plants. Syngamy is the process of fertilization which is not dependent on the release of two/three celled stage of pollen grain. In the exine of pollen grain there are pores called germ pore which enable the elongation of pollen tube after the pollen reaches the stigma.

In the coconut fruit, the edible part and the liquid form the endosperm which is consumed by the embryo during its growth.
